text: A star studded cast that somehow doesn't make up for its lacking writing, but with that said, it should be noted that I did enjoy this movie. It came out mid Covid era, and offered a bit of escapism, with some laughs sprinkled throughout. Also the score must receive a mention, Michael Andrews really brought it home, along with a Kim Wilde song, giving you a  sort of "Breakfast Club" feeling. Fun 6/10
It’s a slow start, but the film actually gets pretty funny and in the end, pretty hilarious . A bit of fun if you’re in the mood for something silly. 4 stars!
Quirky, disconnected, wry humor that can be easily blamed on the British.  Definitely borne out of the pandemic...hell, it might even be the actual documentary from its own plot.

I can't tell if the shitty effects and the shitty acting are on purpose or if it's satire. Only good bit in this movie is Pedro Pascal, although I stopped the movie about half an hour in. Top many things going on and just not a good story in general

Filme ruim, o roteiro é fraco, as cenas são ruins, o elenco é mais ou menos, e ninguém ajuda a melhorar a porra do filme, a história é fraca, e o filme coloca cenas de dinossauro todo fudidos com humanos, eu não recomendo esse porra de filme vai toma no cu.
Watched about 20 minutes before I realized this was just boring nasty "humor."

Just caught this on Netflix. Funny, goofy humor. It's everything how I imagined Hollywood was/is. The reference to a Tom Cruise movie being filmed at same time, Hilarious. The fact that the actual world was terrified of everyone dying... and that Hollywood would make it a top priority to get Cliff Beasts 6 out for distribution

Grasped satire over its conveying message only to be met with tiresome groans over aimless jokes resulting unsatisfactory that cements the poor stretch of their ideas, thus becoming a familiar directorial low whilst squandering a talented ensemble. (C-)
neat concept. some good messages in it. was ultimately disappointingly personally. made me cry
not funny! Not a scene. I really tried hard. Those massive talents, do they only work for the money, or do they read scripts as well?

A real disappointment, especially since there's so much one could actually satirize here. Apatow settles for a kind of cowardly laziness where he sort of remakes "Tropic Thunder" without any of that movie's edge or humor.
This is a dumb movie, but it knows it's dumb.  I laughed, but I like silly stuff.  I can understand why other people didn't like it.
About a half hour too long ,but still enjoyable
Very few jokes and lots of pointless dance sequences make this hard to watch. A surprisingly good cast for such an unfunny turkey.
A completely humorless mess despite the talent.

I thought this movie was going to be funny but by 20 min into the movie I wanted it to be over already.  Seriously, I kept wondering what was the plot. It wasn't funny enough to just remain pointless for the duration. It was stupid. What a disappointment.
Shorter and with more dancing
How can you not love a movie with flammable nuts?
I liked it. It's one of those stupid movies like Sharknado or Epic movie, I like those kind of movies. It wasn't funny but it was fun and idea was good.

Admittedly the only reason I watched this movie is because I love everything Pedro Pascal has done, well apparently I love everything he's done besides this movie. It's filled to the brim with cringey and just outright bad jokes. The only redeemable part of the movie was Deeter and Howie. I heard it was bad, but genuinely wasn't expecting it to be THIS bad. Just skip this one,  it's not worth it.
